alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Sierra County Lakes; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:25PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Otero, northeastern Sierra and northeastern Dona Ana Counties through 815 PM MDT... At 724 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 30 miles northwest of Tularosa to 10 miles southwest of Three Rivers to 8 miles northwest of Bent. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. Winds ahead of any rainfall will be the main concern. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph with areas of blowing dust reducing visibilities to around 3 miles. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tularosa and Salinas Peak. This includes Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 78 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Sierra County Lakes; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
